sentence.Network_en: Hurstwood was something of a romanticist after his kind.

sentence.Network_en: With Wagner and Beethoven, the classicist and romanticist Brahms dominated the music of the 19 th century.

sentence.Network_en: Nathaniel Hawthorne was the pioneer of romanticist and psychoanalytic novels in the history of American literature.
sentence.Network_cn: 纳撒尼尔·霍桑是美国文学史上的浪漫主义小说和心理分析小说的开创者.

2. an artist of the romantic period or someone influenced by romanticism
